actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a four-year term for Members of the House of Representatives and to provide that a Member of the Senate or the House of Representatives may not serve more than two terms.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Provides for a four-year term of office for Members of the House of Representatives. Limits Representatives to two consecutive four-year terms and Senators to two consecutive six-year terms.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a four-year term for Members of the House of Representatives and to provide that a Member of the Senate or the House of Representatives may not serve more than two terms.
